intro: Tacsonia fulgens, commonly known as the fiery tamarack, is a strikingly beautiful plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Betulaceae family, which includes birches and alders, and is characterized by its distinctive, bright yellow foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated margin, adding to its ornamental appeal. Tacsonia fulgens is valued for its vibrant autumn color and its ability to provide habitat for various wildlife species.
